intro: Leucanthemum vulgare subsp. multicaule, commonly known as the common oxeye daisy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features a rosette of basal leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals surrounding a yellow central disk. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it spreads via its creeping rhizomes. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
